title: Get half a size bigger
review: Seriously comfortable hikers.Half a size bigger than normal fits me perfectly.Put the waterproof claim to a gentle test (long, wet grass) and it was fine.I like the low-profile look of these shoes. I have read some of the key professional review sites' opinions on these shoes and they say they 'do not look modern enough'. Well, give me that every time if that means they look like normal trainers and they perform like proper waterproof hikers.I'll admit I don't have the same confidence in these shoes' waterproof capability as I do with my Salomon X Ultra 4 GTX (which pretty much failed in the uppers after three years).But I went in with my eyes open and the Moab 3 GTXs are a great buy, in my opinion.

title: A great investment for anyone looking for comfortable, durable, and versatile shorts.
review: I recently purchased the Wrangler Authentics Men's Classic Cargo Stretch Short and I am thoroughly impressed with my purchase. These shorts are not only comfortable and versatile, but they are also durable and stylish.The traditional cargo style is perfect for any occasion, whether I'm going hiking or just running errands. The relaxed fit sits at the natural waist with a relaxed seat and fit through the thighs, making them extremely comfortable to wear all day long. Plus, with a 10-inch inseam, I never have to worry about them being too short or too long.One of my favorite features of these shorts is the quick-access storage they offer. With (6) pockets, including (2) side cargo flap pockets, (2) slash pockets, and (2) back patch pockets, I have ample space to store my personal items and gadgets. This is especially convenient when I'm on-the-go and need to have everything I need at my fingertips.The materials used in these shorts are also incredibly durable. I appreciate that they are offered in a variety of stretch fabrications including twill and rip stop, ensuring they will last for years to come. The heavy-duty hardware, including the zipper fly and button closure, gives me peace of mind that they won't fall apart after just a few wears.Overall, I highly recommend the Wrangler Authentics Men's Classic Cargo Stretch Short. I plan on purchasing more in different colors to add to my wardrobe!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 April 2023

title: Very Heavy, Clunky
review: This review isn't in anyway negative towards the seller. They were great. My disappointment is towards the shoe itself. I know they are platforms. I've bought a pair of platform suede pumas in the past. These are much higher though. The gel foam is amazing. And the first time I slipped my foot inside it was like stepping on a marshmallow - soft, squishy and comforting. The Black all over is cool and what I was looking for for work. But then that's it.This shoe is really not for day to day if you walk alot. It feels like I've strapped on a pair of bricks. They are so clunky and heavy that it feels like a work out each walk. I can't count how many busses and trains I've lost cause there is no point in running for them and I'm a 10k runner. It's actually exhausting.So if you want a cool, comfortable shoe for minimal walking then these are for you.

title: Budget Nike Shoe. Needs Break-In time to make comfortable.
review: Made to the cheapest budget, and unless you only wear formal shoes most of the time; really not that comfortable when first worn.My last pair of Nike shoes lasted 20 years, but, with planned obsolescence, I doubt these will last much time at all, but presumably far longer than any entry-level brands.This is money for old rope for the company, but if you were to step into even the cheapest Asics gel or foam shoes, you'd realise what instant comfort should feel like; which is what I did after returning these Tanjun shoes. The quality and comfort are worlds-apart.

review: Habe inzwischen das vierte Mal den Nike Tanjun als Haupt- bzw. Standard-Schuh und bin immernoch zufrieden. Preis-Leistung absolut top. Benutze die Schuhe das ganze Jahr √ºber und bei jedem Verlassen des Hauses, die Schuhe halten bei mir i.d.R. 2-3 Jahre, bis die Sohle entweder von unten (au√üen) oder von oben (im Schuh drinnen) abgewetzt ist. Zum Sport benutze ich sie nicht, dazu waren sie glaub ich nicht so gut geeignet. An sich sind sie aber total bequem, wie ich finde. review: Ich hatte diese Modell nun schon zwei Mal gekauft. Tolle Passform, leicht und in schwarz sehr dezent auch auf der Arbeit zu tragen. Die Schuhe haben immer so 1 - 1,5 Jahre gehalten. Nicht wegen der Verabeitung des Schuhs, sondern weil dann die Sohle einfach glatt gelaufen war (relativ weiches Material). Aber das ist auch in Ordnung gewesen. Nun habe ich mir die Schuhe wieder bestellt, wie immer eine Nummer gr√∂√üer, da der Schuh klein ausf√§llt. Unterschied ist eine jetzt gr√ºne (vormals rote) Einlegesohle.Zu meiner √úberaschung war dieses Paar Schuhe seitlich nun so eng, das ich sie zur√ºcksenden musste. Ich konnte es nicht glauben und bin zu einem √∂rtlichen H√§ndler, der leider nur eine andere Farbkombination f√ºhrt und wollte wissen , ob das evtl. an der neuen (gr√ºnen) Einlegesohle liegt. Zu meiner √úberraschung habe dessen Tanjuns einwandfrei gepasst. Verstehen tue ich das Ganze nicht-gibt es da solche Toleranzen? Anhand der Modellnummer war es auch nicht das Damenmodell oder waren die am Ende vom Hersteller falsch ettiketiert?

title: F√ºr sehr breite F√º√üe etwas zu schmal, aber trotzdem sehr bequem
review: Als begeisterter Sneaker-Liebhaber habe ich mir k√ºrzlich den Nike Herren Downshifter 12 Sneaker zugelegt und m√∂chte meine Eindr√ºcke teilen.Der erste Eindruck der Schuhe ist √§u√üerst positiv. Das moderne Design des Downshifter 12 verleiht ihm eine vielseitige √Ñsthetik, die sich leicht in verschiedene Outfits integrieren l√§sst. Die Verarbeitung ist, wie von Nike gewohnt, hochwertig und robust, was auf eine langlebige Qualit√§t hindeutet.Was den Tragekomfort betrifft, so kann ich sagen, dass die Downshifter 12 Sneaker ihre Versprechen halten. Die Polsterung im Inneren der Schuhe sorgt f√ºr eine angenehme D√§mpfung, was besonders bei l√§ngeren Spazierg√§ngen oder sportlichen Aktivit√§ten sp√ºrbar ist. Die Passform ist ebenfalls bemerkenswert, und der Schuh bietet ausreichend Halt, ohne dabei unbequem zu sein.Ihr ist f√ºr mich jedoch ein Negativpunkt vorhanden. Meine F√º√üe sind etwas breit, weswegen die Schuhe etwas zu dr√ºcken scheinen, aber dennoch komfortabel sind.Die Sohle des Downshifter 12 ist gut gestaltet und bietet eine ausgezeichnete Traktion auf verschiedenen Oberfl√§chen. Egal, ob ihr auf der Stra√üe unterwegs seid oder leichte sportliche Aktivit√§ten aus√ºbt, die Schuhe geben das Vertrauen und die Stabilit√§t, die man ben√∂tigt.Ein weiteres Plus ist die Atmungsaktivit√§t der Schuhe. Auch bei l√§ngeren Tragezeiten bleibt das Fu√üklima angenehm, was insbesondere an warmen Tagen oder w√§hrend intensiverer sportlicher Aktivit√§ten wichtig ist.In Bezug auf die Haltbarkeit hat Nike auch hier gute Arbeit geleistet. Die Materialien zeigen wenig Abnutzungserscheinungen, und die Schuhe behalten ihre Form auch nach h√§ufigem Tragen bei.Zusammenfassend kann ich sagen, dass die Nike Herren Downshifter 12 Sneaker eine gelungene Kombination aus Komfort, Stil und Funktionalit√§t sind. Ob f√ºr den Alltag oder leichte sportliche Bet√§tigungen, diese Sneaker erf√ºllen die Anforderungen an einen zuverl√§ssigen und modischen Schuh. Ich kann den Nike Downshifter 12 Sneaker jedem empfehlen, der auf der Suche nach einem vielseitigen und bequemen Schuh ist.

title: A good product. The product looks original
review: Bought this product from Amazon for 2550.Was skeptical initially whether its will be a genuine product.Did some research on the web and some verification and came to conclusion that its Original on the basis of the following points:1. The product is lightweight and fits as expected . The finishing looks authentic.2. Scanned the QR codes on the shoes (tongue) . The QR code displays the the same number as printed on the tongue. (The numbers differ for each foot)3. The box looks original (their original one box design) which also has removable adhesive stickers (to seal the box during returns). The logos on the box, swoosh design and everything seems to be original.4. I had bought pegasus 40 a month back, from one of the Nikes official 3rd party retailer. The box design was an exact match with the current one received.5. The SKU printed on the box and the shoes matches with the official Nike website.6. The description on the tongue is stitched and not pasted.Some observations:1. The QR Code number on the box and shoes do not match. (Assuming this may be because of the return and the shoes was put in a different box)2. The QR code on the tongue takes you to Nike website but not to the specific product. (Not sure what is the expected behavior)3. Amazon is not their official Nike 3rd party retail partner.Now if this product is still fake, then I suggest Nike to acquire the company or recruit the people behind this as they are real talents :)

title: Ein Allrounder
review: Nachdem Durchlesen der Rezensionen habe ich den Schuh eine Nummer gr√∂√üer bestellt als meine regul√§re Schuhgr√∂√üe. Er passt perfekt. Ich nutze ihn als Laufschuh, weil ich eine flexible Sohle bevorzuge. Der Fu√ü soll beim Joggen mitarbeiten. Neben der flexiblen Sohle zeichnet sich der Schuh durch das weiche Obermaterial aus. Es dr√ºckt an keiner Stelle, gibt dem Fu√ü aber trotzdem soviel Halt, dass er beim Laufen auf der Sohle bleibt und nicht seitlich ausbricht. Der Schuh ist so leicht und bequem, dass ich ihn nochmals kaufen werde und als Freizeitschuh nutze. Der Schuh ist ein Allrounder. Man kann stundenlang darin laufen, ohne dass man Fu√üprobleme bekommt. Die Farbe entspricht genau der Abbildung. Der Nike Laufschuh ist f√ºr jede Gelegenheit empfehlenswert.

title: New Nike Shoes too Narrow and Weird Arch Support
review: Nike shoes are now sadly too narrow in the front half. Other brands still fit just fine in 9.5 or 10 (medium width)---but not Nike. I usually get running shoes in a half size larger than dress shoes to accommodate thicker socks, but these were too tight in the toe box  even with thin socks. The arch support in my old Nikes was just fine--in this pair the medial (inner) arch was ridiculously high...it felt like the foot tilted sharply to the outside---and this is supposedly a "neutral" running shoe! Sadly, no more Nike shoes for me---it's Reebok size 10 from now on as they fit nice and snug in the heel (no movement causing blisters) but have plenty of room in the toe box. Reeboks  also seem to be of higher quality than the new Nike shoes.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 8 November 2017

title: If you like 'Nike Tanjun' shoes- these may be right for you
review: Ordered these Nike shoes (black, white, & rose gold) in a 9.5 which are $78 & may need to return & size up a bit to a 10, which are $67 ($11 less). I'm assuming that 9.5 is a more popular size than 10 but the prices for both sizes should be the same ($67). I tried uploading a photo of the shoes for reference but can't for some reason. They look like the photo & come in a shoe box- with no damages. I chose this style to replace my worn Nike Tanjuns that I wear all of the time. This style looks similar to Tanjuns but do have some slight differences, including the texture on the shoe sole which Tanjuns don't have.Update: I did return the 9.5 & exchanged for a 10 but the delivery was not as fast for this pair and they did not arrive in a shoe box or with stuffing inside of the shoe (to maintain their shape). Luckily, the shoes were not damaged during delivery but the packaging should have been the same as the original ones that I received vs. just being put in a plastic bag & sent out. I like to take care of my shoes & appreciate having the original shoe box to put them back into after each wear & after a quick wipe down...
date: Reviewed in the United States on 14 June 2023

title: If you like 'Nike Tanjun' shoes- these may be right for you
review: Ordered these Nike shoes (black, white, & rose gold) in a 9.5 which are $78 & may need to return & size up a bit to a 10, which are $67 ($11 less). I'm assuming that 9.5 is a more popular size than 10 but the prices for both sizes should be the same ($67). I tried uploading a photo of the shoes for reference but can't for some reason. They look like the photo & come in a shoe box- with no damages. I chose this style to replace my worn Nike Tanjuns that I wear all of the time. This style looks similar to Tanjuns but do have some slight differences, including the texture on the shoe sole which Tanjuns don't have.Update: I did return the 9.5 & exchanged for a 10 but the delivery was not as fast for this pair and they did not arrive in a shoe box or with stuffing inside of the shoe (to maintain their shape). Luckily, the shoes were not damaged during delivery but the packaging should have been the same as the original ones that I received vs. just being put in a plastic bag & sent out. I like to take care of my shoes & appreciate having the original shoe box to put them back into after each wear & after a quick wipe down...
date: Reviewed in the United States on 14 June 2023

title: Great shorts at a great price
review: My favorite cargo shorts are Lee Wyoming, but they‚Äôre not really all that cheap. This is where these Amazon Essentials shorts come in. I needed an extra pair for an upcoming trip, so in lieu of spending the cash on some more Lee‚Äôs, I thought I‚Äôd give these a shot. I‚Äôm very pleased with the quality and fit. The length is great too. It‚Äôs very likely I‚Äôll be ordering more of these as my older shorts wear out.There are a few suggestions I have to make a great product even better, though. First, the Lee cargo shorts have a dedicated phone pocket on the right side. Would love to see that on these shorts. Also, would love for the pockets to be a bit deeper.Lastly, I haven‚Äôt had a problem with it, but I did see a complaint on another review about the button on the pockets. They‚Äôre covered by a sewn flap, which could cause some to have trouble undoing the button. I haven‚Äôt had that experience at all, but just be aware.Overall a very nice set of shorts and great quality for the price. Highly recommended.

Had stitching failure on crotch, debating cost of taking em to seamstress as they‚Äôre pretty giod shorts. Did order two more, one (dark blue) went unfilled (popular color?) other cane with back pocket folded and stitched funky but not worth hassle of return. Drop to 4 stars as long as price stays on low end.Jun 23 update - 4+ ‚Ä¶ holding up well. Zippers, stitching all remain functional through very active use. Only thing that could improve these is a built in drawstring as they are pretty slippy against synthetic briefs - the perfect combo for heat/humidity/active environs.

Motivos por los que son mis favoritos: la tela es muy agradable, transpira bien (al contrario que otros), no es una tela que pese mucho (al contrario que otros) lo que lo hace m√°s c√≥modo y f√°cil de llevar, es una tela resistente, aguanta bien los lavados, esta muy bien cosido y terminado (al contrario que otros m√°s caros), es de cremallera y esto es un punto importante para mi, porque es mucho mejor que los otros que son de botones (botones que adem√°s son dif√≠ciles de sacar del ojal y dif√≠ciles de volver a meter). Esto es todo lo que puedo decir. No traen cintur√≥n, pero en definitiva, no te calientes la cabeza buscando pantalones cortos porque estos son los mejores que encontrar√°s por aqu√≠. title: Sello Godin de Oro
review: TLDR: Excelentes shorts de uso diario, no son apretados ni tan sueltos, vienen de la talla correcta y aguantan lavada tras lavada sin perder la forma ni el color. Un producto que vale m√°s de lo que cuesta.Actualizaci√≥n 19/04/2020: Estamos en cuarentena por el COVID-19 y estos shorts siguen como nuevos, es mas, necesito 3 pares nuevos para los otros d√≠as.Mis est√°ndares para shorts ‚Äúdeportivos‚Äù son muy simples. Para empezar no soy un atleta, soy Godin com√∫n y corriente que lo primero que hace al llegar a la casa es ponerse este tipo de shorts para ver Netflix, usar la computadora o la consola para relajarme un rato. Mi experiencia en relajamiento post trabajo me ha llevado a apreciar la ropa deportiva como la m√°s adecuada para sentarse c√≥modamente en un sof√°.Despu√©s de varios meses de uso puedo decir que son shorts de gran calidad, la talla es la correcta y no son ajustados ni de la cintura, entrepierna ni del muslo ‚Äî tampoco quiere decir que son s√∫per sueltos, simplemente son perfectos.Lo primero que pens√© al comprarlos es que perder√≠an el color despu√©s de la tercera lavada ‚Äîvenga, por el precio, dudo que sea el √∫nico que pens√≥ esto, pero fue una grata sorpresa ver que no han cambiado en lo m√°s m√≠nimo, y ya van varias. Aguantan el uso rudo de la lavadora y la secadora sin ning√∫n problema de estiramientos, desgarre o perdida de color.Un gran plus es que no son nada calurosos, viviendo en el puerto de Veracruz esto es algo muy importante.Es un producto que sinceramente vale m√°s de lo que cuesta y sinceramente no te arrepentir√°s.

title: Great quality, fits a little large.
review: I usually purchase XL shorts, and often they're still a little tight on certain areas. These were a pleasant surprise. The length of the legs are a little short, stopping at just above the knee, but the fit itself is great and the waist actually fits loose compared to other XL shorts. The quality is very good and the pockets are large and snug.I plan on buying more of these, although I might need to go down to an L instead of getting more XLs. I'm not sure. The shorts stretch out well but you can't really tighten them, as the elastic band is kept on the inside of the shorts and isn't two separate cords that can be easily tied together. Going down a size may be necessary.

title: A simple pair of shorts, well executed.
review: A few years ago I was looking for some simple, inexpensive, comfortable and cool shorts to wear around the house. I had plenty of "dress" shorts for going out in warm weather, but for at home I wanted something more comfortable for home activities. I was in a store that was carrying Champion brand sports clothing and found these 9" Jersey Shorts with pockets. I'd had this type of shorts in the past, but the Champions are made with hand pockets on the front. They weren't expensive and looked easy to care for, so I bought a couple to try them out. Long story short, I was completely sold! These Champion shorts are all that I was looking for: Inexpensive, well-made, cool, extremely comfortable (that "Jersey" stretch!), easy to care for and the added bonus of the front pockets! This current order was my second through Amazon, which made it so easy to find the exact ones I wanted (in this past year of the Pandemic, everyone's stock has been affected, it doesn't matter what you are trying to find). I highly recommend these Champion Jersey Shorts if you want cool, comfortable and easy to take care of summer leisure wear.

title: Good product, bad colors
review: I like the loose fit, easy to tie, material is light and comfortable.Pockets are ok.But I do have 1 complaint.The choices of color don't make sense to me.They have  light color and a dark color pairing.For shorts this is not very useful, since dark colors are winter color, and can't be worn in the summer.Since they absorb all the suns energy, and act like an oven.Since these are shorts, and made for summer, they should be paired light grey and light beige.It's impossible for me to use the dark ones outdoors in the summer time.And dark colors in general are not healthy, they tend to contribute to pimples and infections if you have a wound, and dark pants can cause to infertility for men, since they are cooking their family joules.I know what your thinking.Then why do we see black spandex and blue jeans in the summer.My answer, in my opinion is, that the people making, and wearing them, are simply going though the motions daily, without ever thinking..Blue jeans in the summer is insane, they will make 4 hours outside feel like 12hours, and make you as grumpy and tired as a sweaty old man.So they should not even have considered, making shorts or short sleeved summer clothes, in dark colors.So my dark one's are going to be used indoors in the winter only.White, Light Grey or very light Beige. are the only colors that should be used for summer clothes.Unless you like suffering.That is my nice and cool opinion. ;)PS:If you doubt my statements, do a test, wear blue jeans outside one day this summer and then switch to Light beige pants.You will never wear dark clothes in the summer time again, and be much happier for it. :)
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 December 2023

title: Solid Workout Companion with Minor Quality Reservations
review: These Men's Performance Tech Loose-Fit Shorts have proven to be a reliable choice for my workout needs. As someone who's active and hits the gym regularly, finding comfortable and breathable workout shorts is crucial, and these shorts deliver on those fronts.The fit is on point - not too snug, not too loose - providing the freedom of movement necessary for various exercises. I appreciate the comfort they offer during my workout sessions, ensuring I can focus on pushing myself without any unnecessary distractions.Breathability is another highlight. The fabric allows for ample ventilation, helping to keep me cool and comfortable, even during intense workouts. This is a crucial factor for me, especially in the warmer months.However, I did notice that the material used isn't of the highest quality. While these shorts get the job done, you can tell they might not withstand heavy wear and tear over the long term. It's a minor concern, considering their affordable price point and the fact that they do perform well during workouts.In conclusion, these Men's Performance Tech Loose-Fit Shorts have become a staple in my workout wardrobe. They excel in fit, comfort, and breathability, ticking off the boxes I consider most important. While the material quality isn't top-notch, these shorts still represent great value for their performance. If you're looking for dependable workout shorts without breaking the bank, these are a solid choice.

title: Unbeatable Comfort for Active Days
review: The Amazon Essentials Men's Performance Tech Loose-Fit Shorts are a game-changer for anyone seeking unbeatable comfort and performance during active days!These shorts are a must-have addition to any workout or casual wardrobe. The performance tech fabric is lightweight, breathable, and moisture-wicking, ensuring that I stay cool and dry even during intense activities.The loose-fit design provides ample room for movement, making these shorts ideal for running, gym workouts, sports, or simply lounging around on weekends.I love the elastic waistband with a drawstring, which ensures a secure and customizable fit. It eliminates the worry of constant adjustments, allowing me to focus on my activities without any distractions.The Amazon Essentials Men's Performance Tech Loose-Fit Shorts feature deep side pockets, providing a convenient and secure place to store essentials like keys, phone, or small workout accessories.The shorts are well-made with sturdy stitching, ensuring their durability and longevity even with frequent use and washing.The variety of color options allows me to choose the style that suits my taste, and the colors are vibrant and maintain their appearance wash after wash.Whether I'm hitting the gym, going for a jog, or just relaxing at home, these performance shorts keep me feeling comfortable and confident throughout the day.In conclusion, the Amazon Essentials Men's Performance Tech Loose-Fit Shorts are a must-have for anyone seeking ultimate comfort and functionality for active days. Their performance tech fabric, comfortable fit, and convenient features make them the ultimate choice for various activities and casual wear. If you're looking for versatile shorts that keep you cool and comfortable during workouts or everyday errands, these Amazon Essentials shorts are the perfect fit. Embrace the ease of movement and practicality for an essential piece of activewear that complements your active lifestyle. I highly recommend the Amazon Essentials Men's Performance Tech Loose-Fit Shorts for unmatched comfort and style on all your active days!

title: Really nice material, fits me perfect
review: I was pleasantly surprised by  how nice these shorts are.  The material is super soft and very comfortable to wear.  The inside is finished with tape at the waist.  Never had a pair of shorts finished this nicely inside.  The material washes and comes out of the dryer great, no wrinkles.  I couldn't seem to find a pair of shorts in the stores that either fit me correctly or were of a material that wasn't cotton.  I do like performance shorts if I'm going to be doing something where I am going to get wet, but for daily wearing, I don't like the non cotton material.  These are the best shorts I've ever owned!  The price is fantastic too.  Very good value for the money.  I bought two pair to start out with and almost immediately ordered another pair in a third color.  My first impression when I put them on was I didn't think the button closure at the top was very well stitched.  It seemed like it was loose and going to fall off.  After wearing them for about 3 weeks with multiple times through the washer and dryer, the button is still attached, it seems like it was stitched that way on purpose.  I'm very happy with these shorts, I used to wear only Carthardt, but they changed their sizing and have gotten very expensive, these shorts are my favorites now.

title: Short but stretchy and comfortable
review: This pair of base layer leggings are perfect to keep warm in many circumstances ‚Äì while skiing/hiking, motorcycling or even jogging on a winter‚Äôs night. They are really thin so you barely notice them.The logo did come off after 2 washes but I don‚Äôt mind that at all. Do have a look at the chart before ordering to make sure they are long enough for you. They are quite stretchy and fit very well. Definitely recommend them.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 October 2021

title: Very thin yet very effectively adds a great deal of warmth to legs.
review: I had to opportunity to try out a pair of size large. Although I'm normally small-medium (32" waist/31" leg), the elastic nature of these meant they were still a relatively snug fit on the legs, the length was a little on the long side, but the elasticated ankles meant it wasn't a problem. The waist was also a good fit, meaning it doesn't feel like it was too loose or would fall down.In terms of quality. The stitching seemed fine, and the material felt nice and soft on the skin. So definitely well made.I tried them out by popping out on a cold windy day with just a pair of jeans. I then put these on underneath and went out 20 minutes later. These made such a difference, I hardly felt the wind blown through my legs anymore, and I'd definitely say you'd last outdoors a lot longer with these on. Though you'd still need warm socks and gloves etc!Pros- Keeps you very warm- Well madeCons- ExpensiveIn summary: Well made, leggings which should keep you nice and warm. My only gripe is that ¬£35 is quite a lot of money, but you're getting a good quality branded product.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 December 2019

title: Comfy running tights
review: Given their focus on rugby clothing, it's no surprise that Canterbury market these as a base layer for rugby training. However, they are equally effective as single-layer running tights. They are not especially thick, so allow your legs to stay cool if you don't wear an outer layer, but still provide some warmth on those cold winter days.  Re sizing, I'm 6'0" of medium athletic build, and the Medium fits me fine.  I guess Large would probably fit me too, but there is plenty of stretch in the material, so Medium is fine for providing a comfy, snug fit.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 December 2019

title: A quality item.
review: First of all I need to tell you that I did not purchase this item but it was sent to me by Amazon in return for an unbiased and honest review.These base layer leggings are beautiful quality, well made and look really stylish - my husband loves them!Can be machine washed at 30 degrees or indeed on cold wash, can cool iron but not over the logo and print but personally I wouldn‚Äôt iron at all, they are skin tight and any creases would instantly be removed.Not had any really cold weather yet to test insulation but would imagine they would be really good.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 January 2020

title: Superb for cold weather outdoor use
review: My son is using and loving these as a base layer under shorts for football training in the winter. These are better than any sporting under layer he's had in the past. They seem to breathe whilst keeping him warm adn in the black colour, they are also understated, which is what he prefers. They wash well and dry quickly for a good turnaround on being reused. This base layer is suitable for any kind of outdoor activity and would work under a full trouser as they are close fitting. I would highly recommend.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 January 2020

title: Simply cool, pull-on leggings (no pocket)
review: A slightly different material mix (and no zipper fastening!) as per the current product description, these smooth finish leggings are exactly as shown in the stock images above.ooOoo~ CANTERBURY LIMITED~ THERMOREG LEGGINGSSIZE : MCOLOUR (external) : BLACK with WHITE & GREY contrast‚ÄòMade in Cambodia‚ÄôooOooFrom the label on the waistband of the pair I received, the 92% POLYESTER/8% ELASTANE combination is comfortably stretchy, but the leggings stay put like a second skin even when the going gets tough, in my experience so far.They measure around 65 cm length, unstretched, on the inside leg on my measure.  The well finished, slim ankles are not too tight, in my case, and the flat waistband is comfortable at around 3.5 cm wide, with a single seam at the back (last image below refers).Recommended wash is cold/30¬∞ but even at that temperature there is already a bit of noticeable cracking on the logo transfer on the back of the calf on my pair, after the second wash.  However, I would be expecting that in time in any case.They dry relatively quickly in a warm airing cupboard ready for the next wearing, also in my experience.[10 images attached]
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 December 2019

title: Better than I expected!
review: These are exactly what I was looking for. I was worried when I saw these are designed to be worn around the natural waist since I've got a belly and wear my pants around my hips. I'd also seen someone say they're 26" long, implying that I'd need to wear them higher than I usually do. I'm 6'6", and wear a size 44 jeans. I ordered a size 46 in anticipation of wearing them higher, but it was unnecessary. Mine are about 20" long, and just cover the knees while standing while wearing them around my hips. The rise to just above the knee while sitting, which is the ideal fit! I've just ordered two more pairs in size 44. These are perfect!

title: Velcro!
review: These are lightweight, reasonably well made, comfortable, and properly sized. The front hip pockets are a little bit on the small side. The one thing I overlooked during my purchase was that all of the flap pockets are secured by velcro, rather than a button, snap, or magnet. If I had noticed this in the description, where it is easy to miss, I would have made a different purchase. For the value though, this seems like a good product. I'll have to wait and see whether they hold up after a few washes, but I guess I have a couple pairs of everyday shorts I can work hard with, or sit and relax.

title: I feel Bad
review: I ordered these shorts and this is on them the shorts had two different labels of size on them.  I did like the style weight and quality.  but due to the label I got a size wayyyyy to big.  I returned them.  Now mind you I am buying new shorts because of a very nice weight loss.  So I ordered another pair I got the size I ordered but those are to big also.  I returned those also.  So I feel guilty buying and returning all of these shorts and I like everyone read the reviews and saw people talking about the size difference issue.  So I purchased a different brand and honestly style 2 sizes smaller than what my original shorts and they fit nice.  I do plan on ordering these shorts in the future.  They were simple to return.  In Arizona I want a light weight short and cargo is my gig so if that is what you are looking for buy these.  Just in your correct size.

title: Nice shorts, but those pockets!
review: I bought these cargo shorts because I wanted "cargo shorts." You know: the military look without all that bothersome drilling, marching, and shooting. (A fashion victory!)Is that a banana in my pocket? YES! And an orange. And a pocket comb. And an extra set of keys. And my sunglasses! (Totally prepared now!)How many times have you been in a restaurant, and thought, "Man! I wish I'd brought my own jar of mayonnaise?"That's what I wanted! MY OWN JAR OF MAYONNAISE!But that's not what I got. I got "(4) cargo-flap pockets," NONE OF WHICH will hold a jar of mayo. Nor my cell-phone, unless I put it in sideways, and even then it wants to jump out because the pocket is just barely deep enough for a sideways phone.Sorry, Wrangler, but whoever came up with this idea should be assigned to the company cafeteria, putting mayo in those little fold-out paper cups for people that want extra. These pockets are the "smart car" of cargo pockets: not big enough for anyone who needs them.The form and fit are nice. I would love to love these shorts. But they get an F for function. Look elsewhere for your mayo-smuggling needs...
date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 May 2019

title: The shorts fit nicely and are on size.

title: Those pockets...
review: Nice cargo shorts, for the shorts. "The Cargo" part is nearly useless. Too many tiny pockets that won't hold anything useful. My cell does fit sideways in one of the pockets but anything in the regular pocket, in my case...keys, will bang against the phone and it just doesn't ride very well. Cell also fits in another pocket but the flap won't close, an accident waiting to happen. Do the people who design these things actually wear them? Ever? I gave 4 stars because I can't give 3.5. Fix the pockets & I'll maybe give them a 4.5 or 5.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 16 July 2022

title: Good shorts

title: Stated Size is Correct!
review: The quality of the shorts was as expected, perhaps even a little better.  The only issue I have is with the reviews on the size:  several reviewers said the shorts came larger than their stated size.  Based upon those reviews, having a waistline btw 32-33‚Äù, I opted to buy a pair size 32.  Upon delivery, I found that it truly was a size 32 and therefore snugger than I wanted.  I should‚Äôve done as I originally planned and bought a size 33.  So I ordered another pair, size 33, and it fits just right.Otherwise, I am satisfied with the quality and fit of the shorts. Their length comes right above my knees, which is just what I wanted, instead of ending higher as seems to be in vogue nowadays based upon other shorts I‚Äôve recently bought.  As others have noted, the shorts ride low just above your hips, not on your waist; this exacerbated the waistline fit issue re the first pair I bought.  But overall, I am happy with the shorts, especially the size 33 pair!  Great value for the $$!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 May 2019

title: given that these are a beautifully crafted product from Wrangler
review: I'm only giving these cargo shorts because they don't come even close to standard sizing for Wrangler, much less for any other major brand. The kind customer who've advised buying a size or two SMALLER were!/are Dead Spot-On in the advice being given. I thank you all for the timely advice. If these ran true to size I would have given these shirts a 5 star review. As these a a tremendous value for the money, given that these are a beautifully crafted product from Wrangler. These are my third color order and received within three weeks and order 2 sizes down have resulted in the exact same fit in all three cases. I normally wear 33 or 34's, depending on the brand, but these fit more like 33.5's than outright 34's. Not biggie, just so you know! One minor caveat, at least to me, these shirts have two stacked pockets stacked vertically on either along with front/side slash pockets and two back flap pockets. All are secured by two strios of Velcro, save the slash pockets. The problem, again, fairly minor is that nobe of any of these pockets are what I would consider deep  for items like a large smartphone, etc

title: These are very nice shorts for a great price that fit perfectly
review: The first thing look for when reading a review is how the clothing fits on someone my basic height and weight.  I saw several reviews that mentioned how these shorts are not slim fit.  I seriously discount that statement.  I am 6'2", about 190 pounds after losing 32 lbs and at least three inches of my waist line in a contest.  Consequently, all of my old golf shorts were WAY too big.  Salvation Army.  Now looking for newer shorts that actually fit.  My thighs are slightly bigger than normal but still some shorts fit as if I was a 20 year old rapper.  I'm not, I'm 59.  Anyway, the price on these Amazon Essential Golf Shorts was too good to pass up.  Bought three pair of the 34" waist.  The fit perfectly.  The length was at least two inches above the knee and definitely a slim fit, but not too slim.  They don't hug the bottom of the thigh.  The pockets were nice and ling and there were two belt loops for the back of the shorts next to the spine for extra support with a belt.These shorts fit true to size,look good, inexpensive, and I'm going to order three new colors.

title: Great shorts at a great price
review: My favorite cargo shorts are Lee Wyoming, but they‚Äôre not really all that cheap. This is where these Amazon Essentials shorts come in. I needed an extra pair for an upcoming trip, so in lieu of spending the cash on some more Lee‚Äôs, I thought I‚Äôd give these a shot. I‚Äôm very pleased with the quality and fit. The length is great too. It‚Äôs very likely I‚Äôll be ordering more of these as my older shorts wear out.There are a few suggestions I have to make a great product even better, though. First, the Lee cargo shorts have a dedicated phone pocket on the right side. Would love to see that on these shorts. Also, would love for the pockets to be a bit deeper.Lastly, I haven‚Äôt had a problem with it, but I did see a complaint on another review about the button on the pockets. They‚Äôre covered by a sewn flap, which could cause some to have trouble undoing the button. I haven‚Äôt had that experience at all, but just be aware.Overall a very nice set of shorts and great quality for the price. Highly recommended.

title: Perfect for travel
review: Not a fan of elastic waist but band is wide and hopefully holds up to wash n wear. Fabric stretch and weight is perfect, length for me just above knee. Stitching, pocket detail seems reasonable. Ordering two more.Update: Zippers and fabric hold up well. Inserted a shoestring on inside of waistband to keep em up when active. Had stitching failure on crotch, debating cost of taking em to seamstress as they‚Äôre pretty giod shorts. Did order two more, one (dark blue) went unfilled (popular color?) other cane with back pocket folded and stitched funky but not worth hassle of return. Drop to 4 stars as long as price stays on low end.Jun 23 update - 4+ ‚Ä¶ holding up well. Zippers, stitching all remain functional through very active use. Only thing that could improve these is a built in drawstring as they are pretty slippy against synthetic briefs - the perfect combo for heat/humidity/active environs.

title: Better than I expected!
review: These are exactly what I was looking for. I was worried when I saw these are designed to be worn around the natural waist since I've got a belly and wear my pants around my hips. I'd also seen someone say they're 26" long, implying that I'd need to wear them higher than I usually do. I'm 6'6", and wear a size 44 jeans. I ordered a size 46 in anticipation of wearing them higher, but it was unnecessary. Mine are about 20" long, and just cover the knees while standing while wearing them around my hips. The rise to just above the knee while sitting, which is the ideal fit! I've just ordered two more pairs in size 44. These are perfect!

title: Velcro!
review: These are lightweight, reasonably well made, comfortable, and properly sized. The front hip pockets are a little bit on the small side. The one thing I overlooked during my purchase was that all of the flap pockets are secured by velcro, rather than a button, snap, or magnet. If I had noticed this in the description, where it is easy to miss, I would have made a different purchase. For the value though, this seems like a good product. I'll have to wait and see whether they hold up after a few washes, but I guess I have a couple pairs of everyday shorts I can work hard with, or sit and relax.

title: I feel Bad
review: I ordered these shorts and this is on them the shorts had two different labels of size on them.  I did like the style weight and quality.  but due to the label I got a size wayyyyy to big.  I returned them.  Now mind you I am buying new shorts because of a very nice weight loss.  So I ordered another pair I got the size I ordered but those are to big also.  I returned those also.  So I feel guilty buying and returning all of these shorts and I like everyone read the reviews and saw people talking about the size difference issue.  So I purchased a different brand and honestly style 2 sizes smaller than what my original shorts and they fit nice.  I do plan on ordering these shorts in the future.  They were simple to return.  In Arizona I want a light weight short and cargo is my gig so if that is what you are looking for buy these.  Just in your correct size.

title: Nice shorts, but those pockets!
review: I bought these cargo shorts because I wanted "cargo shorts." You know: the military look without all that bothersome drilling, marching, and shooting. (A fashion victory!)Is that a banana in my pocket? YES! And an orange. And a pocket comb. And an extra set of keys. And my sunglasses! (Totally prepared now!)How many times have you been in a restaurant, and thought, "Man! I wish I'd brought my own jar of mayonnaise?"That's what I wanted! MY OWN JAR OF MAYONNAISE!But that's not what I got. I got "(4) cargo-flap pockets," NONE OF WHICH will hold a jar of mayo. Nor my cell-phone, unless I put it in sideways, and even then it wants to jump out because the pocket is just barely deep enough for a sideways phone.Sorry, Wrangler, but whoever came up with this idea should be assigned to the company cafeteria, putting mayo in those little fold-out paper cups for people that want extra. These pockets are the "smart car" of cargo pockets: not big enough for anyone who needs them.The form and fit are nice. I would love to love these shorts. But they get an F for function. Look elsewhere for your mayo-smuggling needs...
date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 May 2019

title: Those pockets...
review: Nice cargo shorts, for the shorts. "The Cargo" part is nearly useless. Too many tiny pockets that won't hold anything useful. My cell does fit sideways in one of the pockets but anything in the regular pocket, in my case...keys, will bang against the phone and it just doesn't ride very well. Cell also fits in another pocket but the flap won't close, an accident waiting to happen. Do the people who design these things actually wear them? Ever? I gave 4 stars because I can't give 3.5. Fix the pockets & I'll maybe give them a 4.5 or 5.

title: Stated Size is Correct!
review: The quality of the shorts was as expected, perhaps even a little better.  The only issue I have is with the reviews on the size:  several reviewers said the shorts came larger than their stated size.  Based upon those reviews, having a waistline btw 32-33‚Äù, I opted to buy a pair size 32.  Upon delivery, I found that it truly was a size 32 and therefore snugger than I wanted.  I should‚Äôve done as I originally planned and bought a size 33.  So I ordered another pair, size 33, and it fits just right.Otherwise, I am satisfied with the quality and fit of the shorts. Their length comes right above my knees, which is just what I wanted, instead of ending higher as seems to be in vogue nowadays based upon other shorts I‚Äôve recently bought.  As others have noted, the shorts ride low just above your hips, not on your waist; this exacerbated the waistline fit issue re the first pair I bought.  But overall, I am happy with the shorts, especially the size 33 pair!  Great value for the $$!

title: given that these are a beautifully crafted product from Wrangler
review: I'm only giving these cargo shorts because they don't come even close to standard sizing for Wrangler, much less for any other major brand. The kind customer who've advised buying a size or two SMALLER were!/are Dead Spot-On in the advice being given. I thank you all for the timely advice. If these ran true to size I would have given these shirts a 5 star review. As these a a tremendous value for the money, given that these are a beautifully crafted product from Wrangler. These are my third color order and received within three weeks and order 2 sizes down have resulted in the exact same fit in all three cases. I normally wear 33 or 34's, depending on the brand, but these fit more like 33.5's than outright 34's. Not biggie, just so you know! One minor caveat, at least to me, these shirts have two stacked pockets stacked vertically on either along with front/side slash pockets and two back flap pockets. All are secured by two strios of Velcro, save the slash pockets. The problem, again, fairly minor is that nobe of any of these pockets are what I would consider deep  for items like a large smartphone, etc

title: Version 2 is worse than the original
review: Unfortunately, Storelli took a major step backwards with these. Having owned the original, I was able to see just how many "shortcuts" they made here in order to make these cheaper to produce. First of all, these goalie undershorts have noticeably LESS padding than the originals did, meaning you're getting less protection than you did with the originals, especially when playing on bad surfaces. Secondly, to make things worse, the padding is also thinner than the originals which were nice and thick. My third gripe with these is also that the waistband isn't even used here to keep these pants in place, but rather laces that you need to tie. I don't understand why they went with this route, as the laces just don't give you the same satisfaction as a good waistband did. If anything, it does a lesser job and even can see your undershirt start to ride up on you because of it.Overall: The version 2 Storelli GK undershorts/sliders are a major downgrade from the originals. They're fine if you don't have anything else, but after wearing the originals, it's almost impossible for me to like these.

title: My kid loves these

title: great every-day athletic shorts
review: Very comfortable, medium-weight, and surprisingly breathable. I wear them around the house, in the yard, and for working out.Kind of the optimal design: cool enough for hot weather, heavy enough to not be revealing, long enough that they don't look like running shorts, short enough they don't look like basketball shorts. Not clingy-tight but not a lot excess fabric either on an average-athletic build.They're much more breathable than I would expect for fabric this weight. Unlike some synthetics, the fabric doesn't seem to pick up / hold sweat smells.The mesh-lined pockets are deep enough to hold a large phone or normal men's wallet, but heavier items will swing around if you're moving-- the pockets aren't structured since these are gym shorts.True to size-- not tight-clingy like a lot of UA gear can be.I picked up a pair of these because of the price, not expecting much, but I wear them so much that I've ordered a 2nd pair. I have some Vuoris I like better, but those are literally 5x the price. These are my shorts that get the most use during hot weather.Highly Recommended.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 6 September 2022

You are better off spending the extra money and purchasing shorts that have a flattering fit. These also do not look youthful if that is the style you are going for, and seem a bit old man. title: Really nice material, fits me perfect
review: I was pleasantly surprised by  how nice these shorts are.  The material is super soft and very comfortable to wear.  The inside is finished with tape at the waist.  Never had a pair of shorts finished this nicely inside.  The material washes and comes out of the dryer great, no wrinkles.  I couldn't seem to find a pair of shorts in the stores that either fit me correctly or were of a material that wasn't cotton.  I do like performance shorts if I'm going to be doing something where I am going to get wet, but for daily wearing, I don't like the non cotton material.  These are the best shorts I've ever owned!  The price is fantastic too.  Very good value for the money.  I bought two pair to start out with and almost immediately ordered another pair in a third color.  My first impression when I put them on was I didn't think the button closure at the top was very well stitched.  It seemed like it was loose and going to fall off.  After wearing them for about 3 weeks with multiple times through the washer and dryer, the button is still attached, it seems like it was stitched that way on purpose.  I'm very happy with these shorts, I used to wear only Carthardt, but they changed their sizing and have gotten very expensive, these shorts are my favorites now.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 30 May 2021

title: good price in the sale
review: I bought these in a sale for about ¬£6, I was about to go on holiday so really they were one of those 'I'll buy them because I need an additional pair of shorts to go with the 10+ pairs I already have!'So, move on a couple days and these are fantastic. They are so lightweight it great. For everyday wear as comfort, perfect. I'm not one of these people that think a 'joggy' set is acceptable to wear as something smart, so these really were bought as holiday clothing, but I have found myself wearing them as just comfort wear in and around the house.The fit is great, I'm 6ft1 and 85kg and the medium is just right. I wore them to clean the car and the shorts were dry by the time I had time to dry the car, so another bonus point there.Again, I'm quite conservative when it comes to colours, so the safe bet was black and they are fine. The Puma logo is a little brash but maybe that‚Äôs why you are buying them, like I said I don‚Äôt do sportswear as formal wear, but each to their own. So yes, overall these are a nice little additional to a wardrobe and in the sale a good price.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 July 2023
